text: Hunky Dory is the fourth studio album by David Bowie and was released on 17 December, 1971 through RCA Records. It went to number 3 in the United Kingdom, number 15 in Finland and number 39 in Australia. In 2016 following Bowie's death it went to number 16 in Sweden, number 26 in Denmark, number 30 in New Zealand and number 57 in the United States. == Track listing == All tracks are written by David Bowie, except "Fill Your Heart", written by Biff Rose and Paul Williams. Side one # "Changes" – 3:37 # "Oh! You Pretty Things" – 3:12 # "Eight Line Poem" – 2:55 # "Life on Mars?" – 3:43 # "Kooks" – 2:53 # "Quicksand" – 5:08 Side two # "Fill Your Heart" – 3:07 # "Andy Warhol" – 3:56 # "Song for Bob Dylan" – 4:12 # "Queen Bitch" – 3:18 # "The Bewlay Brothers" – 5:22 == References == Category:1971 albums Category:Rock albums Category:Pop albums Category:David Bowie albums
title: Hunky Dory
